intro: Cynanchum sibiricum f. hypopsilum, commonly known as the Siberian milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the colder regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to harsh, cold climates. Its leaves are usually alternate and pinnately divided, while its fruit is a follicle containing numerous seeds. This subspecies is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
